reviewText: I watched this movie tonight with my husband. We didn't pay much attention to the cover. We read what it was about. Our hearts had already melted for this little boy. The movie does start out kind of slow, but BELIEVE me, it is well worth it! This movie will grab you and hold you in! My husband serves in the military. So it did touch close to home. I can't relate to the drug addiction but I can see how you could fall into a black whole when your life, your world, your love is no longer with you. This movie isn't just inspiring and uplifting, it is about so much more!! I don't normally rate and leave reviews but this one I had to! Believe me, you WONT regret getting this movie!!

reviewText: As a military veteran and military brat myself, I was looking forward to this movie coming out. It is a movie that displays an ignored subject in our society - the military family and their sacrifices. What most people don't understand in America is that every person in a military family serves this country. Wives, husbands and children of military veterans sacrifice on a daily basis so that we all can live free and in peace. This movie is a great example of the strain and sacrifices that military families experience when their hero has to be away for a long extended period of time or worst pays the ultimate sacrifice of dying. I really enjoyed this movie. It had a great story line and is inspiring. The boy in the movie has a voice like an angel. I always have a soft spot in my heart for military brats. For you civilian fokes, a military brat is a child whose parent serves in the military. Another thing I liked about this movie is that it provided a good example of drug addiction and how an addict struggles on a daily basis to stay sober. Lastly, this film was done at the University of Alabama at Birmingham and the surrounding area. A place dear to my heart and a place that I called home for many years. Great movie!
summary: Great movie about a military family's struggle

reviewText: I watched this movie last night on YouTube, and low-budget or not, it is a phenomenal movie! (Just a little side-note: If you liked, or even LOVED this movie, I would strongly recommend "A Christmas Visitor" starring William Devane).This movie, though said to be purely fictional, is actually representative; unfortunately; of many military families out there who have experienced the loss, or even the long-term deployment of someone they hold close to their heart. This may have been a Low-Budget film, but both the acting and the storyline were phenomenal, and this film, imho, beats a lot of the offerings from Hollywood nowadays! The acting was believable enough that I felt like I was watching a long, long military family documentary, and not a movie. It's been a while since I've seen a movie where the characters have so boldly stuck in my mind. I'm a thirty-three year old man, and I cried, so I think anyone who says that "Grown men don't cry" ought to watch this movie. If you're a grown man who says that, then you should DEFINITELY watch this movie.Sometimes when I watch a YouTube video, afterwards, I find myself wishing I could get the time back that I spent watching the video because doing so was such a waste of time; but that couldn't be further from the truth with this movie. If you're someone that just wants to see a great movie, you should definitely give this one a look. I plan to buy this movie very soon, and add it to my video library. God bless and Merry Christmas!
summary: One of the BEST I've ever seen!

reviewText: One of the BEST movies that I have seen in a very long time.  Do not be alarmed by what might seem as a film made with a limited budget.  This movie has depth and meaning. !  'Henry' (Uriah Shelton)  ..... well this kid is just phenomenal. His acting is good, and i thoroughly enjoyed the music. Most of the music includes some freestyling with lyrics that are very in tune with the issues of today. Very moving.  When I introduced this film to my students in class I started by saying that I know that you will like this / enjoy this film.  The film includes the issue/s of domestic abuse, drug/alcohol addiction, homelessness, separation (military), bullying, and death to name a few. I know what you are asking, 'How can this be a good movie?  Well just watch it and see. Additionally, it includes, love, relationships, competition, fun, music, etc.  Just when you think the film is over, there is a surprise.  The students in all my classes enjoyed the film. I have seen the film a dozen times in the past two weeks. I still shed tears today. I have purchased three copies of the film ' Lifted' just so that I can share it with friends and family.  I Highly recommended watching this movie!!  Bring tissues!

reviewText: Every now and then, because of Amazon and Netflix, some little known or direct to video film comes along that I absolutely love.  In 2011, there were2 of them.  One was "Like Stars On Earth", from India, released here by Disney studios, and the other was "Lifted".  I am 70, I'm not a chick, andI'm obviously not a kid.  Lexi Alexander, writer and director, has made one of the most heartfelt films ever, with a twist that will blow almost allbut the most cynical viewers away.  Without being political, this film honors those who honor us with their service.  DO NOT MISS THIS.  I have boughtabout 6 copies so far and have given most away as gifts, and plan to buy many more.  And Uriah Shelton sang wonderfully for a 13 year old, and personallyI preferred his songs to Todd Simpson's music easily, and about equally to Kemrance Young's.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Lifted is an unexpected treasure. A small independent  film with a gigantic heart. I had streamed this on a whim and was nothing short of captivated and deeply moved.The story of a bullied little boy with the gift of song, his struggle to accept his fathers call back to Iraq - his mothers battle for sobriety and his uncanny ability to connect to the people he loves through song.Lexi Alexander directs with a competent hand and clear vision - and despite a few moments of deliberate pulls at emotion - the film has a quiet elegance and profound beauty that both pulls at your heart strings and lifts your spirit.The cast is sensational - not a weak performance to be found. But the film belongs to young Uriah Shelton - he owns the screen and steals your heart. The entire cast is nothing short of outstanding. Dash Mihok is phenomenal as the father and the performance of the mother played by Nicki Aycox is nothing short of fearless and brave.Just a jewel of a little movie with a boundless spirit and profound beauty.
Title: N/A

reviewText: When I ordered this movie I didn't know anything about it other than what I read on the site and for me it was a real surprise when I watched it for the first time.  In all honesty I cannot tell you how many times I've now seen it and I get emotionally tied into it every time. The music is great but you must realize that it is up-beat with some Rap in it as well. I like Rap as long as it doesn't have any bad language or violence in it.  I prefer it to be about God but there is some Rap that is good without singing about the Lord. The Rap in this movie is "Free Styling" and I can never understand how some people can actually do that but they can.  The story line is good but not great but it's definitely a believable story in many ways.  I'm sure you will enjoy Uriah Sheldon's singing as he has a wonderful voice for a young boy and he can rock it with the best of them.Go ahead and buy this DVD as I really son't think you will be disappointed, but the music and part of the story line might upset some people.  There is some violence in it and there are a couple of words used that didn't need to be there. There are also several scenes where drugs are used which is part of the movie.
summary: The story of a dad (Dash Mihok), his wife (Nicki Aycox), and their son (Uriah Sheldon) that will touch on all of your emotions.

reviewText: I have only written 140 reviews on Amazon and only twice has my review differed from the "average" by 2 stars. I never give a synopsis of the story, to me that seems secondary you can read the 5 to 7 paragraph reviews of others. Since I purchase and review many videos, I would rather get an idea of what others think of the movie and hear some of its strong and weak points. That is the reason I look at Amazon reviews of movies and books and comments by users on APPS for my Android. That being said. This movie was rated 3 stars on Netflix and other rating services, not the 14x5star I read before I rented it. This movie is a FEEL GOOD, KIDS and CHICK FLICK. The singing was not that great, and the heavy set black girl, and the young singer with the band were clearly the best and should have won, NOT the "poor" kid with the "AA" mother. I believe the 5 stars resulted from the 3 VERY short scenes of the bullies at school, a caring minister, the druggie neighbors, the very mean grandfather, who not only repeatedly used the "N" word but beat-up the boy. The video also used the bank taking the house from the wife of a GI who could not pay her bills and went back to drugs and booze and compounded by the father giving his life "for his country", an over acted woman judge and the boy singing of the National Anthem and Start Spangled Banner. This was a low budget movie that "slightly tugged at your heart strings", made me tear up and made you hate the Bullies, Bank, the woman judge and the unfairness of life. It was ok for a rainy afternoon but 3 stars may have been a gift.
summary: FEEL GOOD, KIDS and CHICK FLICK with tears
